item.description: New best cheesesteak in Philly: Chubby‚Äôs in Roxborough, across the street from my prior top pick, D‚ÄôAlessandro‚Äôs. Not greasy at all, melts in your mouth. item.description:
@sivavaid @jeffjarvis Another thought: Hit up a Best Buy and see how you find the keyboard on the Lenovo Duet 5 Chromebook. On sale for $379, technically a tablet with detachable keyboard. ARM-powered so longer battery life and light. https://t.co/VTSLhECD60

@sivavaid @jeffjarvis There‚Äôs also a smaller version at the same price (not on sale now) with nearly identical specs. 11-inch display vs 14.
item.source:markdown:
@sivavaid @jeffjarvis Another thought: Hit up a Best Buy and see how you find the keyboard on the Lenovo Duet 5 Chromebook. On sale for $379, technically a tablet with detachable keyboard. ARM-powered so longer battery life and light. https://t.co/VTSLhECD60
@sivavaid @jeffjarvis There‚Äôs also a smaller version at the same price (not on sale now) with nearly identical specs. 11-inch display vs 14.

item.description: @sivavaid @peterrojas I think that Lenovo fits the bill nicely then. You could spend less but you‚Äôll likely have 4 GB of RAM in the device; more RAM is always better for the ChromeOS experience. This model has 8. Keyboard is pretty solid; at this price it won‚Äôt wow you but it won‚Äôt disappoint either.
item.source:markdown: @sivavaid @peterrojas I think that Lenovo fits the bill nicely then. item.description: @peterrojas @sivavaid What‚Äôs your budget and use case(s)? I typically drop $700 - $1000 on a Chromebook for higher end specs to code in the Linux container. But you can get a solid ‚Äúeveryday‚Äù basic use device for around $400. Good example that I like: https://t.co/FdPJRuOpKV

item.description: @markguim Probably true. I‚Äôd say go used if you can which will limit any investment loss. 150cc scooter is great for learning on or for continuing to use for around town / non-highway commute. But once you get the üèç bug, then you‚Äôll be looking to upgrade.
item.source:markdown: @markguim Probably true. I‚Äôd say go used if you can which will limit any investment loss. 150cc scooter is great for learning on or for continuing to use for around town / non-highway commute. But once you get the üèç bug, then you‚Äôll be looking to upgrade.
